thread.title: High-school football | Previewing Friday's top games
thread.title_full: High-school football | Previewing Friday's top games | The Columbus Dispatch

author: The Columbus Dispatch
title: High-school football | Previewing Friday's top games
text:
(All games start at 7:30 p.m. unless otherwise noted) 

GAME OF THE WEEK 

Hilliard Darby (8-0, 5-0) at Westerville Central (8-0, 5-0) 

For the fourth straight season, the winner of this game will take the Ohio Capital Conference Cardinal Division championship. 

“I didn’t know it would come down to this again this year,” Westerville Central coach John Magistro said. “Honestly, we’ve been through so much in terms of key injuries, we’ve just been thinking of getting to the next week. To our kids’ credit, they’ve stepped up. The younger guys have gained come in and gained confidence.” 

Offensively, Westerville Central is paced by Kentucky-bound tailback Benny Snell (1,388 yards, 21 touchdowns), and Darby counters with run-oriented option quarterback Nick Powers (1,214 yards, 19 TDs). 

“We’re clear on the opposite end of the spectrum in the way we do things offensively,” Magistro said. “We spread things out and go fast. They’re old-school in the way they run the option, chew up the clock and play sound defense. Just like last year, it’s a real good matchup. They knocked us off last year (35-10) when we were undefeated, but maybe there’s even more on the line this year.” 


BEST OF THE REST 

Worthington Kilbourne (7-1, 4-1) at New Albany (5-3, 4-1) 

Kilbourne tries to right the ship after a 41-7 loss to Olentangy, and New Albany desperately needs to win its final two games to reach the playoffs. 

Independence (6-2, 4-1) at Marion-Franklin (5-3, 4-1) 

This can be regarded as an elimination game in the City League South Division’s four-way tie that also includes Eastmoor Academy and Walnut Ridge. It also has playoff implications as the 76ers are sixth and the Red Devils ninth in the same region in Division III. 

Beechcroft (5-2, 4-0) at Whetstone (4-4, 3-1) 

Whetstone handed Northland its lone City North loss and will try to play spoiler again. Although the Braves are identified by their 

passing game, their defense has allowed only 46 points the past five games. 

Olentangy Liberty (6-2, 3-2) at Dublin Coffman (5-3, 3-2) 

Once regarded as the elite team in the area, Coffman might need to win out against Liberty and Upper Arlington to make the playoffs. 

Hamilton Township (6-2, 4-1) at Logan Elm (6-2, 4-1), 7 p.m. 

Logan Elm controls its fate in the Mid-State League Buckeye Division and playoffs in closing at home against Hamilton Township and league-leading Teays Valley. 

Columbus Academy (4-4, 1-3) at Bexley (7-1, 4-0), 7 p.m. 

The Headmaster’s Trophy will be on the line when these rivals meet. Columbus Academy, which leads the series 21-14-1, needs an upset to keep its faint playoff hopes alive. 

Harvest Prep (6-2, 4-0) at Fisher Catholic (6-2, 5-0), 7 p.m. 

Two hot teams compete for the Mid-State League Cardinal Division title. Fisher has allowed just 37 points in a six-game winning streak. Harvest Prep is scoring nearly 44 points per game in its five-game winning streak. 

River Valley (6-2, 4-1) at Jonathan Alder (7-1, 5-0), 7 p.m. 

This Mid-Ohio Athletic Conference Red title game pits Alder’s prolific passing game against a River Valley defense that has limited five opponents to single digits. 

Lucas (8-0, 1-0) at Danville (8-0, 1-0), 7 p.m. 

Danville has outscored its opponents 433-32 and Lucas its 375-46. 

— Steve Blackledge 
sblackledge@dispatch.com 
@BlackiePreps
